definition: comma (punct.)
to stay/to stop/to tease (play with)/amusing/short pause in reading aloud, equivalent to comma (also written 讀|读[dou4])
ordinal number/day of a month/mark/sign/business establishment/size/ship suffix/horn (wind instrument)/bugle call/assumed name/to take a pulse/classifier used to indicate number of people
roar/cry/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: The value passed to the actions should be comma-delimited lists of values.
sentences.chinese: 傳遞給動作的值應該是以逗號分隔的值列表。

sentences.english: Semi-colons show a pause which is longer than a comma, but not as long as a full stop.
sentences.chinese: 分號表達的是一個比逗號長句號短的停頓。

sentences.english: A comma-separated value is the default configuration for the delimited data handler.
sentences.chinese: 逗號分隔值是帶分隔符的數據處理程序的缺省配置。

sentences.english: Where there are multiple daemons or clients on a line, separate each one with a comma.
sentences.chinese: 當一行有多個守護進程或客戶端時，用逗號分隔開來。

sentences.english: Use comma to separate and distinguish additional or incidental information inserted into a sentence.
sentences.chinese: 使用逗號分割插入語和主句成分。

sentences.english: A comma should only be used to separate function arguments.
sentences.chinese: 逗號只能用於分隔函數的自變量。

sentences.english: Avoid lazy text-inspired speak, with overuse of dot-dot-dot’s and consecutive commas.
sentences.chinese: 過多使用省略號和連續逗號。

sentences.english: Stay away from the use of colons in greetings and closings and use commas instead.
sentences.chinese: 在問候詞以及結尾用逗號代替冒號。

sentences.english: The access rights are stored as a comma-separated list of rights.
sentences.chinese: 訪問權被存儲成一個以逗號隔開的權限列表。

sentences.english: Commas may be used to write multiple sub-expressions on a single line.
sentences.chinese: 逗號被用來在一行中寫入多個子表達式。

sentences.english: If a match is found, a comma is inserted between the two subpatterns.
sentences.chinese: 如果找到匹配，則在兩個子模式之間插入一個逗號。

sentences.english: If the string contains more than one address, separate the addresses with commas.
sentences.chinese: 如果字符串包含多個地址，地址之間用逗號分隔。

sentences.english: Eliminate commas, that are, not necessary. Parenthetical words _ however _ should be enclosed in commas.
sentences.chinese: 避免不必要的逗號，而附加式說明需要用逗號隔開。

sentences.english: Eliminate commas, that are, not necessary. Parenthetical words _ however _ should be enclosed in commas.
sentences.chinese: 避免不必要的逗號，而附加式說明需要用逗號隔開。

sentences.english: In writing, non-identifying relative clauses are always separated by commas in this way.
sentences.chinese: 書寫時，非限定關係從句總是用逗號隔開。

sentences.english: Comma is a kind of punctuation.

definition: modal particle
punctuation/a punctuation mark
Chinese back-sloping comma 、 (punct. used to separate items in a list)
to write characters in simplified form/the simplified form of a character/to abbreviate (a word or expression)/to write in simple language
ellipsis (punct.)
phonetic symbol
synonym
exclamation mark ! (punct.)
bane of one's existence/vile spawn
to digress/to stray from the subject
faulty wording/mispronunciation due to a speech defect
to ask for trouble/to invite difficulties
saying in which the second part, uttered after a pause or totally left out, is the intended meaning of the allegory presented in the first part
to listen with respectful attention/(a polite request to sb to speak)/we are all ears
lit. if it's wrong, it's wrong (idiom); to make the best after a mistake/to accept an error and adapt to it/to muddle through
(of a pupil) to write down (in a dictation exercise)/dictation/(music) to transcribe by ear
